review: Better than Chromecast. The remote control makes all the difference, the smartphone-app use of streaming sticks gets old really soon.It uses any settings it receives from your wireless router, unlike the Chromecast, which only uses Google's DNSs, overriding your preferences for DNS-masking.You can't travel overseas with the Chromecast if you need particular DNS servers, but you can with the Fire Stick.A con could be that the USB power of many TVs is somewhat not enough for the Fire Stick, while you don't have that issue with the Chromecast.

review: I cannot recommend this device AT ALL if you are a sports fan.  I was watching MLB in what I THOUGHT was "real time" and my sister got on her iphone and kept teasing me because I was 2 outs behind, due to constant buffering issues.  Traded the Amazon stick in for the Roku Streaming Stick and it is BETTER, but STILL the games lag behind on television vs. watching on my laptop.  Trying Roku 2 next...because no one wants their SISTER to be ahead of them by up to half an inning due to buffering issues.
